meanings.definition: Relating to or contained in letters.
meanings.sent1: The epistolary relationship between the two characters was evident in their heartfelt letters.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading epistolary novels that were written as a series of letters between characters.
meanings.sent3: The epistolary nature of their communication made their friendship feel more special.
meanings.sent4: Their epistolary connection was like a thread weaving through the fabric of their lives.
meanings.sent5: The epistolary style of writing added a personal touch to the story.

meanings.definition: Written in the form of letters.
meanings.sent1: The book was an epistolary novel, with each chapter written as a letter from one character to another.
meanings.sent2: She found the epistolary format of the book to be engaging and unique.
meanings.sent3: The epistolary structure of the story gave it a charming old-fashioned feel.
meanings.sent4: The epistolary narrative unfolded like a series of secrets being revealed.
meanings.sent5: Reading the epistolary tale felt like peeking into someone else's private correspondence.

meanings.definition: Of or associated with letters or the writing of letters.
meanings.sent1: The epistolary tradition of writing letters by hand is slowly fading in the digital age.
meanings.sent2: He appreciated the epistolary style of communication, finding it more personal than emails.
meanings.sent3: Their epistolary exchanges were filled with warmth and sincerity.
meanings.sent4: The epistolary world they created through letters was a sanctuary of shared thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The epistolary charm of their correspondence brought a sense of nostalgia.
